gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: decalper_eb_ot_sdeen_pot_pi_dehcac_xnilix. Explanation: This module appears to be for a primitive XADC (Analog-to-Digital Converter) instantiation with specific initialization parameters set. It takes in digital inputs, including addresses and data, and analog inputs. Outputs include various status flags (busy, alarm, etc.) and converted digital data. The converter is likely used to read some physical variable (such as voltage or temperature) and convert it to digital form for processing. Extra unconnected ports seem to suggest that it may have been a part of a larger design before.

Module name: glbl. Explanation: This module seems to simulate global parameters and states commonly found in FPGA, like Global Set/Reset(GSR), Global Tri-State(GTS), and Program Reload(PRLD). This module mainly serves as a top-level structure simulating the global signals of an FPGA and timing conditions for simulating configuration processes. It emulates JTAG(Test Access Port) related signals as well.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
1. Module: decalper_eb_ot_sdeen_pot_pi_dehcac_xnilix

Input Ports:

- daddr_in: Data address input sending the address of data for the XADC module.
- dclk_in: Data clock input signaling the presence of valid data.
- den_in: Data enable input to allow or disallow data transmission.
- di_in: 16-bit wide data input. It is the digital data that is being fed to the XADC.
- dwe_in: Data write enable input to enable or disable the writing of data.
- vauxp3: Analog signal auxiliary positive input.
- vauxn3: Analog signal auxiliary negative input.
- vp_in: Vp input for ADC conversion.
- vn_in: Vn input for ADC conversion.

Output Ports:

- busy_out: It signals whether the module is currently busy.
- channel_out: a 5-bit output that represents the current channel being converted.
- do_out: Data output. It outputs the digital value that the XADC module has produced.
- drdy_out: Data ready output that signals when the data is ready to be read.
- eoc_out: End of conversion output notifying the end of the analog to digital data conversion.
- eos_out: End of sequence output; goes high when the end of the sequence of channels has been converted.
- alarm_out: Output that signals when an abnormal situation has happened.

2. Module: glbl

Input Ports:

There are no input ports in the module 'glbl'.

Output Ports:

- GSR: Global Set/Reset signal, primarily used to bring all initialized variables to known states.
- GTS: Global Tri-State signal, controlling whether the I/O ports are in a tri-state.
- PRLD: Load Pulse for a Shift register.
- JTAG_TDO_GLBL, JTAG_TCK_GLBL, JTAG_TDI_GLBL, JTAG_TMS_GLBL, JTAG_TRST_GLBL: JTAG signals that are used for in-system programmability and debugging.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
1. Module: decalper_eb_ot_sdeen_pot_pi_dehcac_xnilix

Internal Signals:

- NLW_inst_JTAGBUSY_UNCONNECTED: unconnected wire, probably used for debugging or testing purposes in the original design.
- NLW_inst_JTAGLOCKED_UNCONNECTED: unconnected signal, possibly indicating if a JTAG operation is in progress.
- NLW_inst_JTAGMODIFIED_UNCONNECTED: unconnected signal, which probably indicates changes in the JTAG state.
- NLW_inst_OT_UNCONNECTED: unconnected signal, but typically represents over temperature (OT) based on the nomenclature.
- NLW_inst_ALM_UNCONNECTED: unconnected alarm signal, typically used for error alerting and monitoring for abnormal conditions in the system. It is a 7 bit wide signal.
- NLW_inst_MUXADDR_UNCONNECTED: unconnected multiplexer address. Used to select one of many inputs.

2. Module: glbl

Internal Signals:

- ROC_WIDTH, TOC_WIDTH: parameters which likely set the width or the count of some specific internal properties.
- GSR_int, GTS_int, PRLD_int: internal registers that are initialized and manipulated to create signals GSR, GTS and PRLD respectively.
- JTAG_CAPTURE_GLBL, JTAG_RESET_GLBL, JTAG_SHIFT_GLBL, JTAG_UPDATE_GLBL, JTAG_RUNTEST_GLBL: these signals are most likely used for controlling the state transitions of the JTAG state machine.
- JTAG_SEL1_GLBL, JTAG_SEL2_GLBL, JTAG_SEL3_GLBL, JTAG_SEL4_GLBL: these signals are selection signals for the JTAG (Joint Test Action Group) functions, possibly to select between different test or operation modes.
- JTAG_USER_TDO1_GLBL, JTAG_USER_TDO2_GLBL, JTAG_USER_TDO3_GLBL, JTAG_USER_TDO4_GLBL: these are User Defined Test Data Output for JTAG interface signals. They might be used to override standard Test Data Outputs (TDOs) for custom testing scenarios. They are assigned a high impedance 'z' initially.
